NealNew York University ArchivesNew York University ArchivesElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2641university-archives@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-06-10T16:37:31Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New York University Archives
Lawrence H. Ross Papers
Ross, H. Lawrence
MC 311
11 Linear Feet in 8 record cartons and 3 flat boxes
1960-2005 This collection consists of materials collected by Lawrence H. Ross including copies of publications, papers, notes, and plaques and awards related to the Honorable Betty Weinberg Ellerin and NYU School of Law. Materials primarily in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Access to the Lawrence H. Ross Papers is restricted until the collection has been arranged and described by an archivist.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials found in collection; there is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Appraisal
On July 19, 2013 a folder containing Ross' graduate thesis from Harvard University was removed due to the presence of mold.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Preferred Citation
Suggested format for citing materials in a collection: Identification of item, date; Lawrence H. Ross Papers; MC 311; box number; folder number or item identifier; Repository Name, New York University.
Processing Information
Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection have not been made.
Scope and Contents
Materials in this collection include copies of publications, papers, notes, and plaques and awards related to the Honorable Betty Weinberg Ellerin and NYU School of Law.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
New York University. School of Law. Plaques (flat objects) Notes (documents) Publications (documents)
